eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu

Class QuestBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu.QuestBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WauzInventory

    public class QuestBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements WauzInventory
    An inventory that can be used as menu or for other custom interaction mechanics. Sub menu of the main menu, that builds a quest display out of quest configs and manages quest progression.
    Author:
    Wauzmons
    See Also:
    WauzQuest

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public static void open(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Opens the menu for the given player. Shows all quests that the player currently has, aswell as their progress. Also shows options to open the quest finder and toggle the visibility of certain quests. A quest can be tracked, by clicking on it.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that should view the inventory.
        See Also:
        PlayerConfigurator.getCharacterRunningMainQuest(Player), generateQuest(Player, String, int, Material), generateEmptyQust(String), PlayerConfigurator.getHideSpecialQuestsForCharacter(Player), PlayerConfigurator.getHideCompletedQuestsForCharacter(Player)

      • find

        public static void find(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Opens the menu for the given player. Shows all unaccepted quests that are near the player, trackable by clicking on the results. Ordered by level, then by distance from the player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that should view the inventory.
        See Also:
        WauzQuest.getQuestsForLevel(int), generateUnacceptedQuest(Player, WauzQuest, int, boolean), MenuUtils.setBorders(Inventory)

      • generateQuest

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack generateQuest(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                                           java.lang.String questName,
                                                           int phase,
                                                           org.bukkit.Material colorMaterial)
        Creates an item stack, containing information about a running quest. If it is not a main quest, an option to cancel the quest, will be added to the lore.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that is doing the quest.
        questName - The name of the quest.
        phase - The current quest phase.
        colorMaterial - The material of the item stack.
        Returns:
        The quest item stack.
        See Also:
        WauzQuest.getDisplayName(), QuestRequirementChecker.getItemStackLores()

      • generateEmptyQust

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack generateEmptyQust(java.lang.String type)
        Creates an item stack, that represents a free quest slot, that isn't bound to any quest. Used for showing free slots in the quest overview menu.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the quest, for showing in the display name.
        Returns:
        The quest item stack.

      • generateUnacceptedQuest

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack generateUnacceptedQuest(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                                                     WauzQuest quest,
                                                                     int phase,
                                                                     boolean trackable)
        Creates an item stack, containing information about an unstarted quest. Can be trackable for showing in the quest finder, or not, for showing in a dialog.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that is viewing the quest.
        quest - The name of the quest.
        phase - The displayed quest phase.
        trackable - If the quest can be tracked.
        Returns:
        The quest item stack.
        See Also:
        WauzQuest.getDisplayName(), QuestRequirementChecker.getItemStackLoresUnaccepted()

      • selectMenuPoint

        public void selectMenuPoint(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
        Checks if an event in this inventory was triggered by a player click. Cancels the event and handles the interaction with a quest or display option. If a bookshelf was clicked and the player is in the main world, the quest finder will be opened. If an option to hide quests was clicked, it will be toggled and the menu will be reloaded. If a quest is clicked, it will be tracked. If a cancelable quest is right clicked, the cancel dialog will be shown.
        Specified by:
        selectMenuPoint in interface WauzInventory
        Parameters:
        event - The inventory click event.
        See Also:
        find(Player), PlayerConfigurator.setHideSpecialQuestsForCharacter(Player, boolean), PlayerConfigurator.setHideCompletedQuestsForCharacter(Player, boolean), WauzPlayerScoreboard.scheduleScoreboard(Player), QuestRequirementChecker.trackQuestObjective(), WauzPlayerEventQuestCancel

      • accept

        public static void accept(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                          java.lang.String questName)
        Tries to accept or continue the quest. Simplified version.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who is accepting the quest.
        questName - The name of the quest.
        See Also:
        Calls this with null as last param.

      • accept

        public static void accept(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                          java.lang.String questName,
                          org.bukkit.Location questLocation)
        Tries to accept or continue the quest. If the quest isn't already running and no quest slot of the fitting type is available, it is cancelled. If the quest is daily and has a cooldown, the remaining time, till the quest is redoable is shown. If the quest is not daily and already complete, a completion message is shown. If the quest is unstarted, an accept dialog is shown, or accepted directly, if it is a main quest. If the quest is running and phase requirements are not met, an "uncomplete" message is shown. If the phase is completed, the next phase is initiated and an phase description message is shown. If all phases are completed, the quest slot and the phase are cleared, the cooldown for daily quests gets resetted, the quest completions increase, an effect and the completion message is shown and the reward is handed out.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who is accepting the quest.
        questName - The name of the quest.
        questLocation - The location to show exp rewards.
        See Also:
        PlayerConfigurator.getCharacterRunningMainQuest(Player), PlayerQuestConfigurator.getQuestPhase(Player, String), PlayerQuestConfigurator.getQuestCooldown(Player, String), PlayerQuestConfigurator.isQuestCompleted(Player, String), WauzPlayerEventQuestAccept, WauzQuest.getCompletedDialog(), QuestRequirementChecker.tryToHandInQuest(), WauzQuest.getUncompletedMessage(int), WauzQuest.getPhaseDialog(int), PlayerQuestConfigurator.setQuestPhase(Player, String, int), PlayerConfigurator.setCharacterQuestSlot(Player, String, String), PlayerQuestConfigurator.setQuestCooldown(Player, String), PlayerQuestConfigurator.addQuestCompletions(Player, String), WauzRewards.level(Player, int, double, Location), WauzRewards.mmorpgToken(Player)
